title: Prysm 1.0.17 crashes with runtime error: slice bounds out of range
body:
# üêû Bug Report

Prysm 1.0.17 crashes with runtime error: slice bounds out of range. The server is dappnode (see below). The Prysm beacon log:

time="2021-09-01 18:40:32" level=info msg="Processing block batch of size 62 starting from  0xeec42dc7... 1940256/1974800 - estimated time remaining 3h5m43s" blocksPerSecond=3.1 peers=19 prefix=initial-sync
time="2021-09-01 18:40:41" level=info msg="Processing block batch of size 63 starting from  0x59c668bc... 1940320/1974801 - estimated time remaining 1h31m56s" blocksPerSecond=6.2 peers=21 prefix=initial-sync
panic: runtime error: slice bounds out of range [::3950455307] with length 2147483647


### Has this worked before in a previous version?
The system worked well for monthes. Automatic update was disabled. There were no any changes on the server or router. The server crashed suddenly. I tried to restart the server, the router, I updated the Prysm to the last version. The error is still here

## üåç  My Environment

Core DAppNode Packages versions
bind.dnp.dappnode.eth: 0.2.6
core.dnp.dappnode.eth: 0.2.47
dappmanager.dnp.dappnode.eth: 0.2.42, branch: v0.2.43, commit: ec541936
ipfs.dnp.dappnode.eth: 0.2.14
vpn.dnp.dappnode.eth: 0.2.8, commit: f9a8743e
wifi.dnp.dappnode.eth: 0.2.7
System info
dockerComposeVersion: 1.25.5
dockerServerVersion: 19.03.8
dockerCliVersion: 19.03.8
os: debian
versionCodename: bullseye
architecture: amd64
kernel: 5.9.0-3-amd64
Disk usage: 41%

Auto diagnose is Ok:
IPFS resolves
Has connected to the internet, and detected own public IP
No ports have to be opened OR the router has UPnP enabled
NAT loopback enabled, external IP resolves
Disk usage is ok (<95%)
All core DAppNode Packages are running

Hi @VTsuprov. We will look into this as soon as possible. I think your database has been corrupted somehow and you'll need to resync from genesis. 

If you could make a copy of `/data/beaconchaindata/beaconchain.db` and share would us, that would be helpful.
In any case, please delete or rename that db file so that Prysm will complete a full resync. 
Removing this file does not remove any slashing protection history.

> If you could make a copy of `/data/beaconchaindata/beaconchain.db` and share would us, that would be helpful.

You can upload my corrupted file from here
http://badbugs.me/files/beaconchain.db

I deleted all the data and restarted the syncing process from the genesis. The first 10% of syncing went Ok

I have 50% of syncing
But web UI looks strange with errors which should not be linked with the fact that the node has to be yet syncronised
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18898852/131902799-42a5f819-cca6-4ca4-b763-c6deba827326.png)

Finaly, evrth works. As soon as Prysm syncronised from the genesis I again started to mine. It took around 40 hours to sync 30GB of beacon node. I strongly recomend to do at least a copy of blockchain for Dapnode users.
Thanks  @prestonvanloon for your advise.
Closing as this seems to be resolved
